meanings.definition: (verb) to inhabit or overrun in numbers large enough to be harmful or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: The old house was infested with spiders, making it scary to enter.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned building was infested with rats, causing a health hazard.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when ants decided to infest the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure seemed to infest his mind like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The weeds infest the garden, choking out the flowers and vegetables.

meanings.definition: (verb) to be present in large numbers, causing damage or annoyance
meanings.sent1: Mosquitoes infest the swamp during the summer months, making it hard to enjoy outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: Cockroaches infest the kitchen, spreading germs and causing a foul odor.
meanings.sent3: The gossip seemed to infest the office, spreading like wildfire among the employees.
meanings.sent4: Negative thoughts can infest your mind, affecting your mood and outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: Doubt can infest a relationship, causing cracks in trust and communication.
